aas:aasenv.xsi:schemaLocation: http://www.admin-shell.io/aas/3/0 AAS.xsd http://www.admin-shell.io/IEC61360/3/0 IEC61360.xsd http://www.admin-shell.io/aas/abac/3/0 AAS_ABAC.xsd

aas:description.aas:langString: The SingleLevelBomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This “top-down” view is in contrast to the “bottom-up” view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.

IEC61360:definition.IEC61360:langString: The SingleLevelBomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This “top-down” view is in contrast to the “bottom-up” view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.

aas:description.aas:langString: The SingleLevelBomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This “top-down” view is in contrast to the “bottom-up” view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.
A unique reference within Catena-X of this items
The child part of the observed parent item
Encapsulates the properties describing the child part item

The BomAsSpecified defines the view of the OEM or producer of the whole product, e.g. the OEM of a vehicle. It is free of any supplier-related information and specifies the promised and guaranteed content of the whole product to the end customer. This “top-down” view is in contrast to the “bottom-up” view of the SingleLevelBoMAsPlanned, though several sub-aspects are shared. The BomAsSpecified is merely one aspect, which is attached to the twin of the whole product and itself does neither introduce further twins nor reference them. Instead it merely comprises all functional information required by dismantlers, workshops or requestors for used parts to search for and to make a match on the market place.

aas:property.value: DefaultScalarValue[value=e.g. vehicle, winter wheels, bicycle rack, typeUri='DefaultScalar[metaModelVersion=BAMM_2_0_0, urn='http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string']']

aas:description.aas:langString: The description of the part in the primary language of the production facility of the product owner.
Entity encapsulating the properies describing a part

This is the key field of the component which usually keeps the part numbers used in after-sales, e.g. when repairing broken parts and searching for a replacement. This ownerPartId itself isn't usually bound to one part version, with the assumption that all part versions with the same ownerPartId are mutually interchangeable.

This is the version of the part. The engineering will at times supercede an older part version by a newer one, which might have different material aspects, physical dimensions etc., still maintaining compatibility.
The entity encapsulating the properties describing the quantity of a part.
Unit of measurement for the quantity of serialized objects.
The number of objects related to the measurement unit.
Unit of measurement for the quantity of serialized objects.
The number of objects related to the measurement unit.
The description of the part in the primary language of the production facility of the product owner.
